commitResults.messageTitle: Level - 0 Implementation (1) Assigned a variable to hold chatbot name (2) Create 2 print statements (3) Call System exit
Level 1 Implementation (1) Created Gui class to handle I/O operations (1a) Method welcome(): Command list contains (1) List, (2) Bye
commitResults.messageBody:
(2) Edited Duke class - Removed I/O operations from Duke class
(2a) Created a Gui object
(2b) Call welcome method from Gui object
(2c) Store userinput into a string
(2d) Switch case to handle the userinput commands

Note: To slice userinput to extract the command string from the rest of the syntax

commitResults.messageTitle: Level 2 Implementation Duke.java (1) Moved execution of program to programExecution() (2) Created a while true loop for continual program execution until bye command is given (3) Create Constructor to initialise objects (gui, tasklist) (4) List of commands supported [ADD - to add task (string) to a tasklist object, LIST - to print task list, BYE - End program execution]
commitResults.messageBody:
Gui.java
(1) Seperate commands list from welcome message
(2) Add Command included in printCommands()

TaskList.java
(1) Created TaskList class to manage the list of task
(2) printTaskList() -> Print task list
(3) insertTask() -> Insert a task (string) into a ArrayList<string>

commitResults.messageTitle: Level 3 Implementation Create Task Class (1) Status modifier method (markAsDone(), markAsNotDone()) (2) Getter method (statusCheck(), taskDescription())
Level-3 Implementation Duke.java (1) Amended Add command to create and to add task object to the tasklist
commitResults.messageBody:
TaskList.java
(1) Amended ArrayList to take in task object instead of string object
(2) Modified printTaskList() to print task description
(3) modify insertTask() to print task description

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-3 Implementation Duke.java (1) Add Status command to modify status of task Gui.java (1) Add instructions for Status command TaskList.java (1) Modify print task to show status of task (2) Add new method updateTask() to update the status of the task based on specified index and input boolean

commitResults.messageBody:
Task.java
(1) Create method to return a string that contains the description of task and status icon

TaskList.java
(1) Edit printTaskList to print out task list by using the method created in Task.java

(2) Modify ADD case to ToDo instruction

(1) Create an event class

ToDo.java
(1) Create a ToDo class

DukeException.java
(1) Create a new class to return an error message when exception occurs

Task.java
(1) Implemented exception handling for empty input. (e.g. TODO command without anything after it) This will be propogated to all Task objects

Duke.java
(1) Temp commented out all cases except TODO -> To do testing
(2) Handle userinput for
     (a) User enter bye/list with :
     (b) User enter command with semi colon but nothing after it
(3) Change variable name (instruction -> input)

Duke.java
(1) Exception handling for event command moved into event class

Event.java
(1) Exception handling in the event user does not give 3 parameters (task, start, end)

Deadline.java
(1) Exception handling for user input - Accept only 2 parameters

Duke.java
(1) Move splitting of string to Deadline class to conduct exception handling
(2) Remove redundant try-catch loop for TODO switch case

Event.java
(1) Remove redundant variable splitInput

DukeException.java
(1) Create helper functions to check validate user inputs

Deadline.java/Event.java/
(1) Replace number of parameter validation with helper function checkNumParameters()

Duke.java
(1) Move exception handling for Status command to tasklist class -> updateTask() method

TaskList.java
(1) Handle user input for update task method

Duke.java
(1) Added delete command

GUI.java
(1) Added delete command syntax

TaskList.java
(1) Impemented method deleteTask() to delete task based on index

(1) Java Packages
duke package - Contains all the classess
exception package - Contains DukeException
tasks package - Contains Deadline, Event,Task, ToDo, TaskList
gui package - Contains Gui

(1) Edited Syntax of displayed task to aid writing and loading from database

Storage.java
(1) To manage I/O operation to the database file

Duke.java
(1) Remove SAVE command
(2) Automatically save task list to database file when adding/deleting/editing task
(3) Automatically load task list when program start up

(1) Rename Gui -> Ui

(2) Created Command and Parser class from exisiting code. Move relevant code into each class

(3) Create run method in duke.java

(1) Change delimiter for commands from '-' to '_' to accomodate date time input format

Parser.java
(1) Handled edge case when user input 'BYE' or 'LIST' command with ':'

TimeDate.java
(1) Validate user date time input
(2) Convert date time input to display format

The rest
(1) Modify display output with date time display format

TimeDate
(1) Overload validate method to handle date only format -> Include an extra boolean parameter (Does not matter if true or false)
(2) Create a method eventOnDate to check if the task (event or deadline) fall on the user input date

Task/Event/Deadline/ToDo
(1) Create toDisplay method to print string in the correct date format (MMM-dd-yyyy)
(2) Revert toString method to handle standard date format (yyyy-MM-dd HHmm)

Deadline.java
(1) Instead of by: -> will be stored as by= (this is because when we split by : at the start of parser, it will not split this portion too)

Tasklist.java
(1) Create check method to check print out task that fall on the user input date

Event/Deadline
(1) Create methods to return deadline, start time and end time in the respective class
Add header comment to all method
Using Gradle, test cases were implemented to test methods in various classes
Improve coding standard and code quality

(1) Refactor the code to conduct method extraction
(2) Created new method checkTaskStatus from that extraction

TimeDate.java
(1) Rename method eventOnDate -> isTaskOnDate to better reflect its usage

Command.java/TaskList.java
(1) Change method name updateTask to updateTaskStatus to improve code quality.

TaskList.java
(1) Create method to detect duplicate task (description) by comparing input task with exisiting tasks
(2) Insert method in (1) to insertTask method to prevent using from entering duplicate task.

TaskList.java
(1) Implemented findTask() method to print out task that match user input keyword

UI.java
(1) Add instruction for FIND command
(2) Rename bye method to printExitStatement to improve code readability

TaskList.java
(1) Improve detectDuplicate method to accept task of different type but same description

(1) Added classType() method to return type of class. Used this for comparision in detectDuplicate method
Use assertions in various methods and class
